learning_outcomes.description: APST 1.1 Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of physical, social and intellectual development and characteristics of students and how these may affect learning.
APST 1.2 How students learn and implications for teaching
APST 1.3 Demonstrate knowledge of teaching strategies that are responsive to the learning strengths and needs of students from diverse linguistic, cultural, religious and socioeconomic backgrounds.

APST 1.4 Demonstrate broad knowledge and understanding of the impact of culture, cultural identity and linguistic background on the education of students from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander backgrounds.
APST 1.5 Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of strategies for differentiating teaching to meet the specific learning needs of students across the full range of abilities
APST 2.2 Organise content into an effective learning and teaching sequence.
APST 2.4 Demonstrate broad knowledge of, understanding of and respect for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander histories, cultures and languages
APST 3.1 Set learning goals that provide achievable challenges for students of varying abilities and characteristics
APST 3.2 Plan lesson sequences using knowledge of student learning, content and effective teaching strategies
APST 3.3 Include a range of teaching strategies
APST 3.6 Demonstrate broad knowledge of strategies that can be used to evaluate teaching programs to improve student learning.
APST 4.1 Identify strategies to support inclusive student participation and engagement in classroom activities
APST 4.2 Demonstrate the capacity to organise classroom activities & provide clear directions
APST 4.3 Demonstrate knowledge of practical approaches to manage challenging behaviour.
APST 4.4 Describe strategies that support students wellbeing and safety working within school and/or system, curriculum and legislative requirements
APST 6.3 Seek & apply constructive feedback from supervisors & teachers to improve teaching practices.
APST 6.4 Demonstrate an understanding of the continued professional learning and the implications for improved student learning.
APST 7.1 Understand and apply the key principles described in codes of ethics and conduct for the teaching profession.
APST 7.2 Understand the relevant legislative, administrative and organisational policies and processes required for teachers according to school stage

assessments.assessment_title: Planning & Teaching Part A: Planning Adjustments
assessments.due_date:
6/08/2025 - 15/10/2025

Due 5:00pm, weekly on Wednesdays from Week 4 until Week 12.
assessments.task_description: Adjust your weekly planning for UniPE Primary in response to evidence and feedback from supervisors and critical friends.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: 5% of total mark is awarded when all lesson plans are complete and submitted on time.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: In small groups, produce a 12-minute podcast to examine an authentic story of challenging behaviour to analyse the strategies that teachers use to establish and maintain a safe and supportive learning environment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: One person from each group will upload your podcast to Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Planning & Teaching Part B: Teaching Showcase
assessments.due_date:
24/10/2025

On this date, each student will be scheduled for a 30-minute presentation and conversation with their Facilitator.
assessments.task_description:
Showcase how your planning and teaching led to productive learning opportunities for your students including the application of behaviour management frameworks and strategies. You will provide a narrative from your UniPE Primary Professional Experience and support this using primary evidence and academic literature.

In the event of disruption to the Showcase or prior data collection during UniPE, this assessment may be changed and/or the timing may be impacted.

Recording of Assessment:

Assessment Procedure

When a student is required to complete an oral or practical assessment item worth 20% or more, the performance will be recorded and retained as per Appendix 1 as the official recording of the item for re-mark purposes.

Recordings will be stored in a secure manner and will only be accessed for the purposes of:

i. moderation of marking

ii. provision of feedback to the student(s) recorded; and/or

iii. re-marking following a successful re-mark application.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
EDUC2004 Teaching Professional Experience includes Introduction Primary Professional Experience and UniPE Primary.

In order to receive a Pass grade for these professional experiences, you must:

a. complete Codes of Conduct and Student Protection Training relevant to your professional experience school sector;

b. be able to satisfy your Professional Experience supervisor that there is evidence of satisfactory achievement in your teaching performance; and

c. adopt the highest professional standards regarding personal presentation, interactions with school staff and students, attendance, punctuality and preparation.

An inability to meet these requirements will result in an automatic failure for these professional experience despite achievement in other criteria.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Annual certificate of sector-based Code of Conduct/Student Protection Training must be submitted to Blackboard before UniPE Primary begins.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction Primary Prac

1-week fulltime in a primary school working with an HPE teacher and in the classroom.
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction Primary Prac 1-week fulltime in a primary school working with an HPE teacher and in the classroom.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 12(28 Jul - 19 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Lesson Planning & Preparation for UniPE Primary

Practical weekly workshops to develop and practice activity ideas for Friday's UniPE Primary prac. They will include:

  • Unit and lesson design including curriculum alignment, learning goals, success criteria and effectively sequencing tasks 
  • Assessing physical performance in PE 
  • Risk assessments and behaviour management plans 
  • Adjustments to planning based on feedback
learning_activities.topic_description: Lesson Planning & Preparation for UniPE Primary Practical weekly workshops to develop and practice activity ideas for Friday's UniPE Primary prac. They will include: Unit and lesson design including curriculum alignment, learning goals, success criteria and effectively sequencing tasks Assessing physical performance in PE Risk assessments and behaviour management plans Adjustments to planning based on feedback

learning_activities.topic:
Teacher Presence

Unpacking the mystery of teacher presence and how it impacts on behaviour management.

This includes creating positive, safe and predictable learning environment for students, and modelling respectful behaviour.
learning_activities.topic_description: Teacher Presence Unpacking the mystery of teacher presence and how it impacts on behaviour management. This includes creating positive, safe and predictable learning environment for students, and modelling respectful behaviour.

learning_activities.topic:
Managing Challenging Behaviour

Understanding the basics of behaviour management. This includes: Developing and using rules and routines, and the importance of expectations, planning and goal setting.
learning_activities.topic_description: Managing Challenging Behaviour Understanding the basics of behaviour management. This includes: Developing and using rules and routines, and the importance of expectations, planning and goal setting.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 4 To Week 12(11 Aug - 19 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Reflective workshop following UniPE Primary

Weekly workshops following primary school HPE professional experience for all students. Systematically reviewing and reflecting on pre-service teaching experiences, and connecting to lectures and literature in order to make suitable adjustments to planning.

This also includes opportunities to give and receive feedback in a safe, supportive and constructive manner.
learning_activities.topic_description: Reflective workshop following UniPE Primary Weekly workshops following primary school HPE professional experience for all students. Systematically reviewing and reflecting on pre-service teaching experiences, and connecting to lectures and literature in order to make suitable adjustments to planning. This also includes opportunities to give and receive feedback in a safe, supportive and constructive manner.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 4 To Week 12(11 Aug - 19 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
UniPE Primary

Weekly primary school HPE professional experience for all students on Fridays. Planning and implementing practical HPE lessons.

Please note: There is no UniPE on student-free days or during school holidays.
learning_activities.topic_description: UniPE Primary Weekly primary school HPE professional experience for all students on Fridays. Planning and implementing practical HPE lessons. Please note: There is no UniPE on student-free days or during school holidays.

learning_activities.topic:
Essential Skills for Classroom Management

Introducing the ESCM behaviour management framework.
learning_activities.topic_description: Essential Skills for Classroom Management Introducing the ESCM behaviour management framework.

learning_activities.topic:
Behaviour & ALT-PE

Understanding how time on task impacts on behaviour management. This includes the importance of effective rules and routines.
learning_activities.topic_description: Behaviour & ALT-PE Understanding how time on task impacts on behaviour management. This includes the importance of effective rules and routines.

learning_activities.topic:
Crisis Management

Understanding how to appropriately respond to challenging behaviour in a crisis situation. This includes how to respond proportionally and calmly to challenging behaviour.
learning_activities.topic_description: Crisis Management Understanding how to appropriately respond to challenging behaviour in a crisis situation. This includes how to respond proportionally and calmly to challenging behaviour.

learning_activities.topic:
Emotional Intelligence & Difficult Conversations

Understanding how your emotional intelligence impacts on your work with students, parents and colleagues. This includes (i) how to create a positive, safe and predictable learning environment for students, and (ii) how to respond proportionally and calmly to inappropriate behaviour.
learning_activities.topic_description: Emotional Intelligence & Difficult Conversations Understanding how your emotional intelligence impacts on your work with students, parents and colleagues. This includes (i) how to create a positive, safe and predictable learning environment for students, and (ii) how to respond proportionally and calmly to inappropriate behaviour.

learning_activities.topic:
Questioning & Feedback

Focusing on the fundamentals of effective questioning and feedback for learning in practical learning environments.
learning_activities.topic_description: Questioning & Feedback Focusing on the fundamentals of effective questioning and feedback for learning in practical learning environments.

learning_activities.topic:
Diverse Classrooms: Inclusion & Differentiation

Introducing a range of strategies for differentiating your activities for children from diverse linguistic, cultural, religious and socioeconomic backgrounds.
learning_activities.topic_description: Diverse Classrooms: Inclusion & Differentiation Introducing a range of strategies for differentiating your activities for children from diverse linguistic, cultural, religious and socioeconomic backgrounds.

learning_activities.topic:
Diverse Classrooms: Trauma Informed Pedagogies

Introducing a range of strategies for working with children who have experienced trauma.
learning_activities.topic_description: Diverse Classrooms: Trauma Informed Pedagogies Introducing a range of strategies for working with children who have experienced trauma.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 11 To Week 13(06 Oct - 26 Oct)

Preparation for Teaching Showcase assessment

Considering your significant and evidenced planning and teaching decisions together to develop your Teaching Showcase.
learning_activities.topic_description: Preparation for Teaching Showcase assessment Considering your significant and evidenced planning and teaching decisions together to develop your Teaching Showcase.

Diverse Classrooms: Gifted & Talented

Introducing a range of strategies for differentiating your activities for children who are gifted and talented.
learning_activities.topic_description: Diverse Classrooms: Gifted & Talented Introducing a range of strategies for differentiating your activities for children who are gifted and talented.

Introducing a range of strategies for differentiating your activities and creating culturally safe activities for children with Indigenous backgrounds.
